day 4: I have so many assignments due and so little time. stressed! finals are coming up. and here I am, rewatching this music video as if it has the electromagnetic spectrum on it and can teach me what isoelectronic ions are. (spoiler alert: it can. /j)
Whoever's reading this, i hope you read this til the end.  have you ever come to think about what's gonna happen when you die, or when Jesus is gonna come back, why this pandemic is happening  or why Jesus had to die on the cross? i had lots of thoughts when quarantine came. Until i got to know about 'rapture' and until i got to know how in danger i was as a lukewarm Christian. me and my sister wanted to search for the Truth by reading the Bible and educating ourselves toward rapture and Jesus' second coming. i realized how this world hold no purpose without Christ. i turned my back against this world, thinking that i had enough, there is no much time, and Jesus is waiting for me. i gave my life to Him, at first out of fear, but now, out of love, out of undeserved grace, out of the Truth that i can't save myself and i need a Savior like Jesus.   you may already know that we all have sinned against our holy, glorious, and Almighty God and Creator. and as it is said in Romans chapter 6 verse 23, "for the WAGES of SIN is DEATH, but the GIFT of GOD is ETERNAL LIFE, through CHRIST JESUS our Lord."  We all have sinned, and our payment/our wages, is death. But God has given us eternal life through Crist Jesus our Lord. Jesus came down here not to condemn us, not to punish us, not to live life happily, but to live the perfect life that we should have lived, and died the death we should've had. Jesus came down to be the atonement of our sins, He came down to pay our wages because we could not. We must wake up in the Truth that Jesus has paid our fine, Jesus died for us, Jesus rose up again, defeated death, and Jesus will come back again.  are we ready? have we given our life to Him? have we known Him? have we left sin for Him? have we trusted Him? we cannot save ourselves!!  [ For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast.   (Ephesians 2:8â€­-â€¬9) ] we cannot justify our sins!!  [For by works of the law no human being will be justified in his sight, since through the law comes knowledge of sin.(Romans 3:20) ]  He has already paid it, He has given salvation as a free gift and all we have to do is receive it. Let us not trust that we can save ourselves from hell, it will be like jumping a plane without a parachute, thinking that we could save ourself by flapping our wings. we must put on a parachute and put our whole trust in it. Jesus is our parachute.   Jesus loves you, Jesus knows you by name, Jesus wants to set you free, Jesus wants you to come back to Him. Life may be hard, and whatever you are going through, i hope you can trust Him. I hope you can see His great power to remove any pain if He wills. He is coming back soon. Let us repent, turn away from our sins, and ask our Lord for His mercy, ao that He could clean us up. no matter what it is that you are thinking, i hope you would try Jesus first. know that there is nothing, no one, and no other places, that you would rather be but in His arms. Jesus loves you!! I hope you can love Him back right now

Do You Know God Personally? God LOVES you and offers a wonderful PLAN for your life.  Godâ€™s Love â€œGod so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal lifeâ€  Godâ€™s Plan [Jesus speaking] â€œI came that they might have life, and might have it abundantlyâ€ [that it might be full and meaningfulâ€ (John 10:10).  Why is it that most people are not experiencing the abundant life? Becauseâ€¦Man is SINFUL and SEPARATED from God. Therefore, he cannot know and experience Godâ€™s love and plan for his life.  Man Is Sinful â€œAll have sinned and fall short of the glory of Godâ€ (Romans 3:23). Man was created to have fellowship with God; but, because of his stubborn self-will, he chose to go his own independent way, and fellowship with God was broken. This self-will, characterized by an attitude of active rebellion or passive indifference, is an evidence of what the Bible calls sin.  Man Is Separated â€œThe wages of sin is deathâ€ [spiritual separation from God] (Romans 6:23). Man is continually trying to reach God and the abundant life through his own efforts, such as a good life, philosophy, or religion â€“ but he inevitably fails. The only way to bridge this gulfâ€¦  He Died in Our Place â€œGod demonstrates His own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for usâ€ (Romans 5:8).   He Rose From the Dead â€œChrist died for our sinsâ€¦He was buriedâ€¦He was raised on the third day, according to the Scripturesâ€¦He appeared to Peter, then to the twelve. After that He appeared to more than five hundredâ€¦â€ (1 Corinthians 15:3-6).   He Is the Only Way to God â€œJesus said to him, â€˜I am the way, and the truth, and the life; no one comes to the Father, but through Meâ€™â€ (John 14:6).  This shows that God has bridged the gulf which separates us from Him by sending His Son, Jesus Christ, to die on the cross in our place to pay the penalty for our sins. It is not enough just to know thisâ€¦We must individually RECEIVE Jesus Christ as Savior and Lord; then we can know and experience Godâ€™s love and plan for our lives.  We Must Receive Christ â€œAs many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, even to those who believe in His nameâ€ (John 1:12)   We Receive Christ Through Faith â€œBy grace you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves, it is the gift of God; not as a result of works, that no one should boastâ€ (Ephesians 2:8,9).When We Receive Christ, We Experience a New Birth ( John 3:1-8).  We Receive Christ by Personal Invitation [Christ speaking] â€œBehold, I stand at the door and knock; if any one hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to himâ€ (Revelation 3:20). Receiving Christ involves turning to God from self (repentance) and trusting Christ to come into our lives to forgive our sins and to make us what He wants us to be. Just to agree intellectually that Jesus Christ is the Son of God and that He died on the cross for our sins is not enough. Nor is it enough to have an emotional experience. We receive Jesus Christ by faith, as an act of the will. All the work of salvation was done by Jesus Himself. He took upon Himself the punishment for our sins as well as the sins themselves, and went to the cross and paid for every sin that would ever be committed throughout history.  WHAT DOES IT MEAN TO BE BORN AGAIN?...  The phrase â€œborn againâ€ applies to people who have accepted Jesus as their Savior or Redeemer. The born again soul realizes that they are a sinner (Romans 3:23) and that the penalty for that sin is death (Romans 6:23). To rectify the circumstances, God sent His only Son to die in their place, to take the punishment for sin (Romans 5:8). After Jesusâ€™ death, He arose from the dead (1 Corinthians 15:3-6). Jesus is the only way to God (John 14:6) and He provides the blessing of salvation. Each person has the choice to receive or reject Godâ€™s gift through faith (Ephesians 2:8-9) and experience new birth (John 3:1-8).   WHAT IS BIBLICAL REPENTANCE? Biblical repentance is God centered repentance comes from the greek word 'METANOIA' which means change of one's mind and heart which imparts a new direction to the whole life. Repent (To repent, in relation to salvation, is to change your mind from unbelief to belief in Jesus Christ. To being dead in your sins to a new creature in Christ) and believe in the Gospel. Last time we only got the finishing line! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ Jokes aside, I love love love this release, the aesthetics, the vibes, the vocals, all of it is so pretty!
